Item.Value: Unit level, a measure of growth. The max level is LVL_CAP.
Experience points gained. Gain 100 points to earn a new level.
Unit hit points. The unit loses consciousness if this reaches 0.
Chances a unit has to live before they are lost forever.
Amount of damage this weapon causes. Affected by defenses.
Chance that the attack will hit. Affected by terrain and enemies.
Ability to escape critical hits. Affects enemy's crit %.
Weapon Range. A range of 1 can only hit adjacent spaces.
Chance the weapon will strike a critical blow, doing triple damage.
Ability to evade enemy attacks. Affects enemy's hit%.
Ability to attack quickly. High attack speed allows double attacks.
Strength. The higher the number, the more damage you inflict.
Magical power. Increases spell damage and staff range.
Power. The higher the number, the more damage you inflict.
Fighting skill. A higher number improves your hit % and crit %.
Speed. This affects both evasion and attacks.
Luck. This affects many different things.
Defensive skill. Reduces damage from weapons.
Magical resistance. Reduces damage from magic and empowers healing.
Movement. The normal distance you can cross in one turn.
Constitution, or physical size. Affects wield capacity and rescues.
Max rescuing constitution. Units with lower Cons can be rescued.
Traveler. The name of the unit with whom this unit is traveling.
Elemental affinity. Determines compatibility with other units.
Unit rating. The sum of the unit's stats for rough comparisons.
Class archetypes. Determines talents and weaknesses.
Sword mastery level. Affects which weapons you can wield.
Lance mastery level. Affects which weapons you can wield.
Axe mastery level. Affects which weapons you can wield.
Bow mastery level. Affects which weapons you can wield.
Fire magic mastery level. Affects which tomes you can wield.
Thunder magic mastery level. Affects which tomes you can wield.
Wind magic mastery level. Affects which tomes you can wield.
Light magic mastery level. Affects which tomes you can wield.
Dark magic mastery level. Affects which tomes you can wield.
Staff mastery level. Affects which staves you can wield.
Physical condition. Default is normal.
The person this unit shares a deep bond with.
Bonus to damage from supports.
Bonus to hit from supports.
Bonus to critical from supports.
Bonus to defenses from supports.
Bonus to avoid from supports.
Bonus to dodge from supports.
Name of the unit.
The unit's class. Each class possesses unique traits.

Available support partners.
Only units with animation turned on can perform combat animation.
Select which units to field this battle. The number is limited, but the main character must be in your party.
Manage your units' items. Item names that appear in grey cannot be used by that unit.
Consult with the fortune- teller for advice on the coming battle.
View the map. Check the number and type of enemies. Also, check for shops and change your allies' starting positions.
Save any changed information as a temporary checkpoint.
Strengthen the friendships within your army for better team synergy.
Review conversations held around the camp. May provide items and other such bonuses.

Configure game settings such as animation, text speed, and interfaces.
